question: Which of the following is true about the enhanced technical support response times of the Enterprise support plan in AWS? (Select TWO)

answers.a: Provides a 2-hour response time support if your production system got impaired
answers.b: Provides a 48-hour response time support for general guidance
answers.c: Provides a 15-minute response time support if your business-critical system goes down
answers.d: Provides a 12-hour response time support for general guidance
answers.e: Provides a 1-hour response time support if your production system goes down

question: Which IAM service is responsible for enforcing privileges and access controls in your AWS environment?
explanation: You manage access in AWS by creating policies and attaching them to IAM identities (users, groups of users, or roles) or AWS resources. A policy is an object in AWS that, when associated with an identity or resource, defines their permissions.

question: Which AWS service lets you provision either Windows or Linux desktops in just a few minutes and can scale easily to provide thousands of desktops to workers?
explanation: Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed, secure Desktop-as-a-Service (DaaS) solution where you provision either Windows or Linux desktops in just a few minutes and quickly scale to provide thousands of desktops to workers across the globe.

question: Which of the following is true if you store your data in AWS?

answers.a: AWS has the right to review any data stored for potential threats.
answers.b: Encryption is required for all data at rest and in transit.
answers.c: You are the owner of the data you store in AWS.
answers.d: All data are stored durably and redundantly in different AZs.

explanation: AWS knows that their customers care deeply about privacy and data security. That’s why AWS gives you ownership and control over your content through simple, powerful tools that allow you to determine where your content will be stored, secure your content in transit and at rest, and manage your access to AWS services and resources for your users.

question: What service allows you to create alarms that notify you when EC2 CPU Utilization thresholds are breached?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch monitors your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources and the applications you run on AWS in real time. You can use CloudWatch to collect and track metrics, which are variables you can measure for your resources and applications.

question: Which of the following services allow you to mask downtime of your application by rerouting your traffic to healthy instances? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS ELB and Amazon Route 53 help mask downtime by redirecting traffic to your healthy instances and allowing failover to your secondary systems. This is achieved through a combination of different health checks, routing policies, and failover policies.

question: How can your RDS production instances be more cost-effective when they will be used for a long period of time?

answers.a: You can easily backup, terminate and restore RDS instances when you need them.
answers.b: You can avail of reserved instances to get discounts on your instance costs.
answers.c: You can stop your RDS instances when idle to prevent AWS from charging you during this time.
answers.d: AWS does not charge you when your RDS is idle.

explanation: Amazon RDS Reserved Instances give you the option to reserve a DB instance for a one or three year term and in turn receive a significant discount compared to the On-Demand Instance pricing for the DB instance.

question: Which type of Elastic Load Balancer allows you to forward the incoming request to a target group with a Lambda function as a target?
explanation: ALB is best suited for load balancing of HTTP and HTTPS traffic and provides advanced request routing targeted at the delivery of modern application architectures, including microservices and containers.

question: Which AWS support plan includes a Concierge Support Team which will assist you with your billing and account inquiries, and work with you to implement billing and account best practices?
explanation: The Concierge Support Team is composed of AWS billing and account experts that specialize in working with only enterprise accounts.

question: You wish to host a static website of your own in AWS at a low cost. Which service should be used for this purpose?
explanation: Amazon S3 infrequent access is incorrect because this may not be the storage choice for a static website. Since this is a website, you expect multiple visitors a day who will also be accessing your objects at a frequent rate. S3 infrequent access GET requests cost more than a standard S3 storage type.

question: You are planning to create point-in-time backups of your Amazon EBS volumes. Which of the following are correct statements? (Select TWO)

answers.a: Instances will have to be stopped first to start the EBS backup
answers.b: You can create point-in-time backups through EBS snapshots
answers.c: Backing up the same EBS volume will create a new back up of the whole volume
answers.d: You can take EBS backups by creating AMIs
answers.e: EBS backups are stored durably on S3

explanation: You can take EBS backups by creating Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) is incorrect because EBS backup volumes are not called AMIs. Backing up the same EBS volume will create a new back up of the whole volume is incorrect because EBS Snapshots are incremental, which means that only the latest changes are backed up when you run the backup process.

question: Which of the following is a serverless compute service of AWS?
What is the best way to keep track of all activities in your account?

answers.a: Use AWS CloudWatch Logs to log all activities.
answers.b: Use LDAP authentication on your account.
answers.c: Set up MFA logging to know who is currently in your environment.
answers.d: Enable AWS CloudTrail on all regions.

explanation: AWS CloudTrail is a service that enables governance, compliance, operational auditing, and risk auditing of your AWS account.

question: Which of the following should you set up in order to connect your AWS VPC network to your local network via an IPsec tunnel?

answers.a: An on-premise NAT gateway device connected to your VPC's Internet Gateway.
answers.b: A VPN gateway in your VPC connected to the Customer Gateway in your on-premises network.
answers.c: VPC Peering connection between your on-premises network and VPC.
answers.d: A NAT gateway in your private subnet connected to your on-premises network.

explanation: An Amazon VPC VPN connection links your data center (or network) to your Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC). A customer gateway is the anchor on your side of that connection. It can be a physical or software appliance. The anchor on the AWS side of the VPN connection is called a virtual private gateway.

question: You are having a hard time tracking the different background jobs with parallel or sequential steps across your distributed application system. What AWS service will simplify this task for you?
explanation: With AWS Simple Workflow, you can create workflow tasks that will simplify and automate operations for you. You can configure automatic retry to allow SWF to retry failed activity or workflow tasks along with your given conditions.

question: ________ is an online software store that helps customers find, buy, and immediately start using the software and services that run on AWS.
Which of the following is the most cost-effective service to use if you want to coordinate multiple AWS services into serverless workflows?
explanation: AWS Step Functions provides serverless orchestration for modern applications. Orchestration centrally manages a workflow by breaking it into multiple steps, adding flow logic, and tracking the inputs and outputs between the steps.

question: You are planning to deploy a video streaming application with frequently accessed, throughput-intensive workloads to your EC2 instance which requires fast, consistent throughput. What EBS volume type should you use to maximize performance as well as cost?
explanation: Throughput Optimized HDD (st1) volumes provide low-cost magnetic storage that defines performance in terms of throughput rather than IOPS. This volume type is a good fit for large, sequential workloads such as Amazon EMR, ETL, data warehouses, and log processing.

question: Your web servers are showing relatively poor performance in delivering content. How can you improve its performance and cost efficiency?

answers.a: Run more web servers to distribute the workload.
answers.b: Request AWS to use faster network cables for your servers
answers.c: Use HTTP protocol instead to decrease the time consumed in decrypting content.
answers.d: Apply a caching mechanism that stores frequently accessed content.

explanation: Caching is a technique that stores previously calculated data for future use. This technique is used to improve application performance and increase the cost-efficiency of an implementation. It can be applied at multiple layers of an IT architecture.

question: Which service will allow you to quickly deploy your application into the AWS Cloud without having to build or launch the individual resources yourself?

You have a fleet of on-premises servers that require a centralized scalable and durable file storage. It should be able to support massive parallel access. Which of the following is the most appropriate service to use?
explanation: Amazon EFS is designed to provide massively parallel shared access to thousands of Amazon EC2 instances, enabling your applications to achieve high levels of aggregate throughput and IOPS with consistent low latencies.

question: Which of the following services should you use to deploy and easily rollback a web application from your Git repository to your on-premises server?
explanation: AWS OpsWorks is a configuration management service that helps customers configure and operate applications, both on-premises and in the AWS Cloud, using Chef and Puppet.

question: Which of the following practices demonstrate operational excellence in AWS cloud? (Select TWO)

answers.a: Deploy small, incremental change to your production servers using AWS CodeDeploy.
answers.b: Perform monthly game days on your AWS environment.
answers.c: Launching your infrastructure manually via the Console.
answers.d: Monitor EC2 metric consumption and adjust the instance type accordingly.
answers.e: Use serverless applications such as AWS Lambda.

question: Which service in AWS supports various business intelligence tools such as Apache Spark so that you may perform data transformation workloads (ETL) and analytics at a low cost?
explanation: Amazon EMR is a web service that enables businesses, researchers, data analysts, and developers to easily and cost-effectively process vast amounts of data. It utilizes a hosted Apache Hadoop framework running on the web-scale infrastructure of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) and Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3).

question: Which AWS service lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources?
explanation: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define. You have complete control over your virtual networking environment, including selection of your own IP address range, creation of subnets, and configuration of route tables and network gateways.

question: You have a large number of log files that will be archived in AWS for a long time and should have a retrieval time of 12 hours or less. Which service is the most cost-effective storage class for this purpose?
explanation: S3 Glacier Deep Archive is Amazon S3’s lowest-cost storage class and supports long-term retention and digital preservation for data that may be accessed once or twice in a year

question: Where can you track the costs you’ve incurred so far in your AWS account with a graphical visualization?
explanation: The AWS Cost Explorer service has an easy-to-use interface that lets you visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time.

question: Which of the following AWS well-architected pillars discusses the selection of the right resource types and sizes based on workload requirements?
explanation: The performance efficiency pillar focuses on using IT and computing resources efficiently. Key topics include selecting the right resource types and sizes based on workload requirements, monitoring performance, and making informed decisions to maintain efficiency as business needs evolve.

question: Which service in AWS is best used for data analytics and data warehousing?
explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fast, fully managed data warehouse that makes it simple and cost-effective to analyze all your data using standard SQL and your existing Business Intelligence (BI) tools.

question: A company is planning to deploy their high-frequency trading (HFT) application which will store constantly changing financial data in AWS and require low latency access. Which AWS services below should you use? (Select TWO)
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely. Which of the following best describes what an account alias is in IAM?

answers.b: The numerical value of your account ID
answers.c: A substitute for an account ID in the web address for your account
answers.d: The name AWS assigns to your account

question: A customer wants to run their application in the cloud via EC2 instances. Their code is currently stored in Github. Which tool could they use to launch their code onto EC2 instances?
explanation: CodeDeploy is a deployment service that automates application deployments to Amazon EC2 instances, on-premises instances, serverless Lambda functions, or Amazon ECS services.

question: Which of the following security group rules are valid? (Select TWO)

answers.a: Outbound MySQL rule with IP address as source
answers.b: Outbound HTTPS rule with hostname as destination
answers.c: Inbound RDP rule with an address range as source
answers.d: Inbound TCP rule with instance ID as source
answers.e: Inbound HTTP rule with security group ID as source

explanation: Security groups accept IP address, IP address range, and security group ID as either source or destination of inbound or outbound rules.

question: What is the main benefit you receive when moving to serverless from non-serverless compute services?

answers.a: You get overall cheaper costs compared to using non-serverless services.
answers.b: Serverless removes management overhead so you can focus on your applications instead.
answers.c: Serverless are highly available so you don't have to worry about downtime.
answers.d: Security is fully managed for you bu the service provider.

question: You have multiple AWS accounts in your organization. How can you take advantage of this to save on your monthly costs?

answers.a: Use AWS Organizations and enable consolidated billing.
answers.b: Set a budget for each account to minimize spending.
answers.c: Migrate all resources to central account to take advantage of volume discounts.
answers.d: Create an IAM Group containing all the AWS accounts and enable consolidated billing.

explanation: AWS Organizations is an account management service that enables you to consolidate multiple AWS accounts into an organization that you create and centrally manage. AWS Organizations includes account management and consolidated billing capabilities that enable you to better meet the budgetary, security, and compliance needs of your business.

question: Among the following payment options, which of the following can you choose when you purchase a Standard or Convertible Reserved Instance? (Select TWO)
Which AWS service allows you to check if your running resources conform with the AWS best practices?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor is an application that draws upon best practices learned from AWS’ aggregated operational history of serving hundreds of thousands of AWS customers. Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and makes recommendations for saving money, improving system performance, or closing security gaps.

question: Which of the following AWS services are used to secure your VPC network? (Select TWO)
explanation: A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your instance to control inbound and outbound traffic. Security groups act at the instance level, not the subnet level. A network access control list (ACL) is an optional layer of security for your VPC that acts as a firewall for controlling traffic in and out of one or more subnets.

question: Which of the following is needed to retrieve a list of your EC2 instances using the AWS CLI?
explanation: The AWS Access Key ID and AWS Secret Access Key are your AWS credentials. They are associated with an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user or role that determines what permissions you have.

question: Which type of EC2 instance is the most suitable and cost-effective if the customer will be running mission-critical workloads continuously for a whole year?
explanation: Both On-Demand and Dedicated Instance Types are incorrect since they are more expensive than Reserved Instances if billed over a whole year or longer. Spot Instance is incorrect since this is not optimal for servers that need to be continuously running.

question: Which of the following are advantages of Cloud Computing? (Select TWO)

answers.a: Massive discounts for your computers, network devices and other equipment from Amazon online shopping website.
answers.b: Trade capital expense for variable expense.
answers.e: Trade variable expense for capital expense.

question: A customer wants to further secure his network beyond security groups and network access control lists. Which of the services below can be used to provide the additional security features? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior to protect your AWS accounts and workloads. AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect your web applications from common web exploits that could affect application availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources.

question: Which of the following services allows you to store Docker images and orchestrate Docker containers in a simple and cost-effective manner? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) is a highly scalable, high-performance container orchestration service that supports Docker containers and allows you to easily run and scale containerized applications on AWS. Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) is a fully-managed Docker container registry that makes it easy for developers to store, manage, and deploy Docker container images.

question: Which of the following services allows you to purchase Reserved Instances? (Select TWO)
You are tasked to simplify the migration of your databases from your on-premises server to AWS. Which service fits best for this purpose?
explanation: AWS Database Migration Service helps you migrate databases to AWS quickly and securely. The source database remains fully operational during the migration, minimizing downtime to applications that rely on the database. The AWS Database Migration Service can migrate your data to and from most widely used commercial and open-source databases.

question: How can you easily and securely copy your infrastructure to another AWS Region?

answers.a: Create a golden AMI which you can use to redeploy your instances to the new region.
answers.b: Enable RDS multi-AZ to have a similar database instance running in the new region.
answers.c: Take an EBS snapshot of your storage devices and copy them to the new region.
answers.d: Create a CloudFormation template and deploy it in the new region.

explanation: AWS CloudFormation provides a common language for you to describe and provision all the infrastructure resources in your cloud environment. CloudFormation allows you to use programming languages or a simple text file to model and provision, in an automated and secure manner, all the resources needed for your applications across all regions and accounts. By turning your infra into code, you can deploy the code in your other regions.

question: The use of multi-threading in your Amazon S3 requests via the Multipart Upload API is an example of which AWS cloud best practice?
explanation: The Think Parallel best practice accentuates the use of parallelization when designing architectures in the AWS cloud. It is advisable to not only implement parallelization wherever possible but also automate it because the cloud allows you to create a repeatable process every easily.

question: What service acts as a firewall for your EC2 instances?
explanation: A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your instance to control inbound and outbound traffic. When you launch an instance in a VPC, you can assign up to five security groups to the instance. Security groups act at the instance level, not the subnet level.

question: Which of the following is a continuous delivery service that you should use to automate your release pipelines for fast and reliable application and infrastructure updates?
explanation: CodePipeline is a fully managed continuous delivery service that helps you automate your release pipelines for fast and reliable application and infrastructure updates. CodePipeline automates the build, test, and deploy phases of your release process every time there is a code change, based on the release model you define. This enables you to rapidly and reliably deliver features and updates.

question: What service should you use in order to add user sign-up, sign-in, and access control to your mobile app with a feature that supports sign-in with social identity providers such as Facebook, Google, and Amazon, and enterprise identity providers via SAML 2.0?
explanation: Amazon Cognito lets you add user sign-up, sign-in, and access control to your web and mobile apps quickly and easily.

question: Which among the options below is tied to a specific Availability Zone where it was launched?

You noticed that you cannot reach one of your EC2 web servers behind an ELB whenever you enter the DNS name of your load balancer. Which of the following should you first check to gain more insight on the issue?
explanation: Your Application Load Balancer periodically sends requests to its registered targets to test their status. These tests are called health checks.

question: ________ is AWS’s digital user engagement service that enables AWS customers to effectively communicate with their end users and measure user engagement across multiple channels including email, Text Messaging (SMS) and Mobile Push Notifications.
explanation: Amazon Pinpoint also provides tools that enable audience management and segmentation, campaign management, scheduling, template management, A/B testing, analytics and data integration. It captures data to track deliverability as well as usage and messaging analytics covering a range of dimensions including user, channels and custom attributes.

question: A customer wants to send push notifications to her mobile users whenever a new patch comes out. What service is the most appropriate for this task?
explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) is a highly available, durable, secure, fully managed pub/sub messaging service that enables you to decouple microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications.

question: Which of the following statements is true for AWS CloudTrail?

answers.a: CloudTrail is able to capture application error logs from your EC2 instances.
answers.b: CloudTrail is disabled by default for newly created AWS accounts.
answers.c: CloudTrail charges you for every management event trail created.
answers.d: When you create a trail in the AWS Management Console, the trail applies to all AWS Regions by default.

explanation: The option that says: CloudTrail is able to capture application error logs from your EC2 is incorrect because CloudTrail actually does not capture error logs in your EC2 instances. You may instead use CloudWatch Logs for this purpose. The option that says: CloudTrail charges you for every management event trail created is incorrect because actually, CloudTrail does not charge you for your first management trail, but only the additional management trails you create after the first one.

question: Which of the following is the responsibility of the customer in the AWS cloud? (Select TWO)

answers.b: Managing users in their AWS account
answers.c: Upgrading chipsets to the latest commercially available product
answers.d: Managing data stored in the AWS resources
answers.e: Ensuring that AWS services comply with the standards required of them

question: A customer needs to identify the IAM user who terminated their production EC2 instance in AWS. Which service should they use in this situation?
What is the minimum support plan that will provide you access to all Trusted Advisor Checks?
explanation: Basic and Developer support plans are incorrect because these will only allow you access to the 7 core Trusted Advisor checks.

question: Which of the following infrastructure correlates to a VPC’s subnet?
explanation: A VPC spans all the Availability Zones in the region. After creating a VPC, you can add one or more subnets in each Availability Zone. Each subnet must reside entirely within one Availability Zone and cannot span zones. Availability Zones are distinct locations that are engineered to be isolated from failures in other Availability Zones. By launching instances in separate Availability Zones, you can protect your applications from the failure of a single location.

question: Which of the following services will be able to reroute traffic to your secondary EC2 instances in another region during disaster recovery?
Which service in AWS allows you to host your own Puppet Enterprise infrastructure?
explanation: AWS OpsWorks for Puppet Enterprise is a configuration management service that provides managed instances of Puppet. Puppet is an automation platform that allows you to use code to automate the configurations of your servers. OpsWorks lets you use Puppet to automate how servers are configured, deployed, and managed across your Amazon EC2 instances or on-premises compute environments.

question: In which of the following occasions should you use the Amazon SQS application system? (Select TWO)

answers.a: If you need to decouple certain parts of your system for better fault tolerance
answers.b: When you have to automate certain tasks in your workflow
answers.c: If you need to submit push notifications to your event subscribers
answers.d: When your application requires the use of industry-standard messaging protocols for message delivery
answers.e: If you require durable storage for your application events or messages

explanation: If you need to submit push notifications, you should use Amazon SNS instead. If you need to automate certain workflows in AWS, you should use Amazon SWF. If your messaging service requires the use of certain protocols, try using Amazon MQ.

question: What is a primary reason why you should be using an elastic load balancer?

answers.a: ELBs boost your website's overall performance
answers.b: ELBs help you scale easily without manual intervention
answers.c: ELBs help tighten security through the use of security groups
answers.d: ELBs provide elasticity by directing traffic to a minimum number of instances required to handle the traffic load

explanation: For automatic scaling of your compute capacity, you need another service called AWS Auto Scaling to go with your load balancers. Although ELBs do add security for your instances, it is not solely because of security groups. Security groups can be used directly with EC2 instances, so this statement is not the best answer for the scenario.

question: Which of the following provides you access to Reserved Instance (RI) purchase recommendations based on your past usage and indicate potential opportunities for savings as compared to On-Demand usage?
explanation: If you enable Cost Explorer, you automatically get Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS, ElastiCache, Amazon ES, and Amazon Redshift Reserved Instance (RI) purchase recommendations that could help you reduce your costs.

question: What feature will allow you to label and sort your EC2 instances according to their deployment stage (development, staging, production)?
explanation: To help you manage your instances, images, and other Amazon EC2 resources, you can optionally assign your own metadata to each resource in the form of tags. Tags enable you to categorize your AWS resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment. This is useful when you have many resources of the same type—you can quickly identify a specific resource based on the tags you've assigned to it.
